imdb.title: Asobi Asobase
imdb.plot: Three girls form a school club. They play games, but the outcomes often alarm them.

episodes.title: Equivalent Exchange/Cheap Thrills/Pleasure Seekers/The Kind Pervert
episodes.plot: Olivia has an odd way of playing look-the-other-way. Her opponent, Hanako, convinces Kasumi to play against her instead. This is the beginning of the Pastimers Club.

episodes.title: Killing Time/Friendship Game/The Witch Trials/Non-title Match
episodes.plot: The Pastimers don't have the minimum number of members necessary to be officially recognized as a club. They attempt to negotiate with the student council president, who isn't impressed by the club's activities.

episodes.title: A Battle That Must Be Won/Puppets/Betting My Life
episodes.plot: Kasumi isn't amused at the stakes involved in the game that Hanako and Olivia are playing. Her well-meant intention to make the game more wholesome backfires.

episodes.title: Lower Body Lasers/Pots and Kettles/Illegal Occupation/Butt Play
episodes.plot: Maeda, who works at Hanako's home, fires lasers from his butt. This offers Kasumi with a unique perspective for her fan fiction.

episodes.title: Devilish Taste/Loaded Questions/Maeda's Curse/Sex Ed
episodes.plot: Hanako arrives at a café to meet up with Olivia and Kasumi. Olivia and Kasumi were just commenting on how this is the first time they've seen each other out of their school uniforms and when they see Hanako, they are shocked. Olivia asks Hanako if she hit her head on the way there, but Hanako tells them that her clothes were a very special kind of haute couture.

episodes.title: Asterisk/Studying for Exams/A New Look/Spirited Combat, Again
episodes.plot: Hanako and the other girls are asked by Oka-san from the Occult Research Club if they want to read a grimoire with her. They ask Oka-san how gathering members is going for the club and she tells them that she hasn't been able to find anyone since. Apparently the reason she ended up on her own suddenly is two had graduated, one had transferred and another one teleported. After hearing that, Hanako and the others didn't know what to do.

episodes.title: Phantom Thieves: Pass Club/Woman of Terror/Weirdo Go/Boobie Tragedy
episodes.plot: Hanako, Olivia, and Kasumi are asked by Aozora Tsugumi to go into the student council room to retrieve the Banana Papers that are hidden somewhere in there. The Banana Papers contain scandals that have happened around school and the student council president is apparently using that to blackmail other students. Hanako and the other girls try to decline the request, but Tsugumi manages to buy them all off one way or another and they end up having to go get the Banana Papers.

episodes.title: Gotta "Catch" 'Em All/Divine Revelation/The Evil Sugoroku
episodes.plot: When Hanako sees Olivia wandering around the classroom with her face glued to her smartphone, she assumes she's playing that popular monster-collecting game, but it turns out that she's playing an unfamiliar game called Bactéri GO. Olivia explains that the objective of the game is to collect the many kinds of bacteria that populate the area, and that it was developed in her parents' country. She describes the game in detail to Hanako.

episodes.title: Troubles of a Fake Foreigner/A Dutchey Wife/Genetic Engineering
episodes.plot: Olivia's classmates try to strike a conversation with her during the break after English class. She hadn't talked to them much until then, even though their seats are nearby, but thanks to Hanako and Kasumi, who don't speak to her much in class, her classmates are still under the impression that she's fluent in English. Olivia begs Hanako to talk to her more in class so she can fix the misconception that she's good at English.

episodes.title: Heart Go Boing Boing/Hanako's Trial of Shame/Secret of the Dong/Film Production
episodes.plot: Because of her appearance, Fujiwara-san is assumed to be good at classical literature, even though her talent is in English, having replaced Olivia in the English speech contest and won. She's exasperated by all of her classmates who come to her to ask for help with classical literature during break time, and she comes to Olivia for someone to speak in English with. Olivia becomes fearful, suspecting that Fujiwara-san has figured out that she can't speak English.

episodes.title: Goodbye, Student Council President/Oka-ken Witch Project/Face of Mass Destruction
episodes.plot: The three visit the student council president to demand that their film be accepted for the cultural festival. The president, meanwhile, is busy trying to get the vice president to let her visit the boys school across the street.

episodes.title: Daniel/Bra Meeting/Fairy Tale Battle Royale/Paper Wars
episodes.plot: The Pastimer's Club look after Chisato's friend's baby Daniel, who they soon discover has a bad attitude for his age. Hanako looks into buying her first bra, only to discover her bust is smaller than she thought. The girls play a cutesy appearing online game, which soon turns out to be a gory battle royale game. Afterwards, the girls, along with Maeda, play a drawing battle game that makes little sense.

episodes.title: OVA: Cosplay Contest/To the Future Me
episodes.plot: Included with seventh volume of the Asobi Asobase manga.

episodes.plot:
